TextMultiSelect.Question: Based on the narrative, what did Jonas think about the men who became pirates? Choose all that apply.
TextMultiSelect.Answers: They were highly skilled and honorable Many joined because they had no other option to try and make money They were willing to risk their life and face dangers for their way of life Many of their characteristics were undesireable They liked a relaxing life at sea
TextMultiSelect.policy: Score points when all answers are correct.

PictureMultpleChoice.Question: Analyze the maps below which show trade routes. Which map depicts the trade route that Jonas and many other pirates of the time plundered?

WordMatch.Question: Match the correct location with its role in Jonas' life.

WordPair.target: A port of call where Jonas spent enjoyable times
A nation that controlled many merchant ships
Sea that Jonas and his fellow pirates sailed

TextMultpleChoice.Question: Which conclusion about piracy can be determined from the text?
TextMultpleChoice.Answers: Spanish Empire trade routes were sometimes obstructed by pirates Most pirates had been captured while on another type of voyage Jonas would easily be able to transition back to life on settled land Many pirates lived a long and happy life The way pirates are shown in movies has been very accurate

WordPictureMatch.Question: Consider the details of the ship images and the facts you have studied about different eras of history. Match the image to the correct description.

WordPicture.source: A ship used by pirates in 1597.
